pullRequest.title: new perun-auditlogger component
pullRequest.bodyText:
New perun-auditlogger component that reads audit log messages and logs them via syslog.
The pull request contains:

sources of the auditlogger component in perun-auditlogger module
startup scripts for init and systemd in perun-utils/init.d-scripts and perun-utils/systemd
default logback configuration (in jar on classpath)

Auditlogger configuration:

perun-auditlogger.properties at default location (configurable by perun.conf.custom property), properties:

auditlogger.statefile - location of file that contains id of the last successfully sent message (default /tmp/auditlogger.state)
auditlogger.consumer - name of the consumer passed to pollConsumerMessages() (default auditlogger)


/etc/default/perun-auditlogger - read by startup script, may override default setting by including the following variables:

SYSLOG_HOST - name of the server with running syslog (default localhost)
SYSLOG_FACILITY - syslog facility used for the logged messages (default LOCAL0)


logback-auditlogger.xml - logback configuration file, its location may be specified by logback.configurationFile property (only on java command line, ie. in startup script)

may be used to completely redefine the logging behaviour
the syslog-appender and syslog-logger are used to feed messages into syslog



IMPORTANT

the host configured as SYSLOG_HOST must have a syslog daemon running and listening on UDP port 514 for incoming messages (usually disabled by default)
example of configuration for rsyslogd is here:


module(load="imudp")
input(type="imudp" address="127.0.0.1" port="514")
local0.*        /var/log/perun/auditlogger.log

nodes.bodyText: I wouldn't keep theses "changes" here, since it was related to the original script.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,165 @@
+#! /bin/sh
+### BEGIN INIT INFO
+# Provides:             perun-auditlogger
+# Required-Start:       $local_fs $remote_fs $network
+# Required-Stop:        $local_fs $remote_fs
+# Default-Start:        2 3 4 5
+# Default-Stop:         0 1 6
+# Short-Description:    Perun AuditLogger
+# Description:          Starts Perun AuditLogger component.
+### END INIT INFO
+#
+# Written by Michal Prochazka <michalp@ics.muni.cz>
+# Modified by Pavel Zlamal <zlamal@cesnet.cz>
+# Modified by Michal Vocu <michal.vocu@gmail.com>
+#
+# 22.06.2017 Use /etc/perun/logback-auditlogger.xml and /var/log/perun/
+# 24.03.2016 Create /var/run/perun if not exists, will work when started on system boot

nodes.bodyText: I would use own name instead of perunLdapc.

I think we want this to be persistent, not disposable on server restart. Yet I'm not sure, how is this handled in dockerized version of LDAPc @martin-kuba ? On instances without docker, we have this property set to ./[filename] which leads to the same folder as jar.
So there are two solutions. We can have default fallback value here and do not set property on each instance or we can explicitly set default in properties file and keep current default value (or any other required by the docker).
I think we can use BL instead of Entry layer to avoid authorization check, which might be the reason you used perunLdapc principal in the session, which is by default configured to be perun admin.
Why do we need this file? There is no such file for perun-ldapc. It should be create automatically by maven-shade-plugin.

commit.message: changed default location of state file
